a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Value of 1 tonne of cobalt¹, in constant 1998 US$ per tonne.
Data source: USGS - Historical Statistics for Mineral and Material Commodities (2023)
Note: This data is adjusted for inflation.
1. Cobalt: Cobalt is used in a number of industries: consumer electronics (it’s in most mobile phones and laptops), catalysts for the oil industry,
resistant metal alloys, and ceramics. In clean energy, it’s mostly used in electric vehicles. Cobalt is a critical element in lithium-ion batteries, which
are the dominant battery technology today.
